H0.text: Proposing different conclusions from the same data is the most likely first step other scientists might take when checking the conclusion reached after an experiment.

H1.text: Studying the data to evaluate the conclusion is the most likely first step other scientists might take when checking the conclusion after an experiment.

H2.text: Changing current models to fit the conclusion is the most likely first step other scientists might take when checking a conclusion reached after an experiment.

H3.text: Developing new technologies based on the conclusion is the most likely first step other scientists might take when checking the conclusion after an experiment.

A4.text: Other scientists may start their own research and formulate their own hypothesis.

A5.text: For significant or surprising results, other scientists may also attempt to replicate the results for themselves.

A7.text: Only after one or several such successful replications should a result be recognized as scientific knowledge.
